intro: Encyclia chloroleuca var. yotocoensis, commonly known as the Yotoco orchid, is a species native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It is a terrestrial orchid characterized by its compact growth habit and dark green, strap-like leaves. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white and green, often with a yellow or greenish throat. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to high-altitude conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
